qas.question: Who accused H&M of using products made by child labours?

answers.text: Anti-Slavery International and the Environmental Justice Foundation (EJF)

qas.question: Who else did they accuse of using child labor products?
What country did the cotton come from that was picked by children?
What are activists trying to get implemented?

context: In December 2009, campaigners in the UK called on two leading high street retailers to stop selling clothes made with cotton which may have been picked by children. <a0_0>Anti-Slavery International and the Environmental Justice Foundation (EJF)<a0_0/> accused H&M and <a1_0>Zara<a1_0/> of using cotton suppliers in <a2_0>Bangladesh<a2_0/>. It is also suspected that many of their raw materials originates from Uzbekistan, where children aged 10 are forced to work in the fields. The activists were calling to ban the use of Uzbek cotton and implement a <a3_0>"track and trace" systems<a3_0/> to guarantee an ethical responsible source of the material.
